stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the session rebuilding and bug-fixing the Goomba King boss fight in Return to Yoshi’s Island, while demonstrating engine fixes (mip-maps, lighting, bloom) and discussing YouTube strategy.

development_findings.summary: Goal of the stream is to implement Biobak’s requested rework of the Goomba King fight, including new behaviour where the player must lure a boulder into the boss.
development_findings.quote: So you have to aim the boulder at him.

development_findings.summary: Discovered an animation glitch in spiky Goombas caused by a single face_angle_pitch value; corrected code to stop them disappearing mid-fight.
development_findings.quote: There is one moment in the face angle pitch where this graph just goes crazy. It's probably this.

development_findings.summary: Imported the wrong Goomba King model on first attempt; re-exported correct version with proper leg pose and closed-eye state.
development_findings.quote: Why is the Goomba sideways? Yeah. Is this the wrong Goomba King? This is the wrong Goomba King.

development_findings.summary: Added mipmaps to textures and repaired N64 lighting after finding a macro bug, improving visual quality on real hardware.
development_findings.quote: Mipmaps. I did it… I also fixed the lights on N64.

development_findings.summary: Experimented with a full-screen bloom shader; current prototype costs ~7 ms RDP time, making it viable only in small sub-areas.
development_findings.quote: The guy that made this said it cost him 7 milliseconds of RDP time.

development_findings.summary: Random offset for Goomba King movement originally ranged 0-1 instead of –1-1; fixing this restored proper lateral motion.
development_findings.quote: It generated numbers between 0 and 1, not between minus 1 and 1. That would do it.

development_findings.summary: Minion Goombas now physically push the boulder; each pushes by five units, and their combined force accelerates the rock.
development_findings.quote: That way both Goombas can push it and it kind of looks like it pushes faster when both Goombas are here.

development_findings.summary: Collision and geometry around the arena simplified (removing unreachable tris) for minor RAM savings and a small FPS boost.
development_findings.quote: This saves like three bytes of RAM size… actually also a very, very minor FPS boost.

development_findings.summary: Boss doors will open when the Goomba King becomes angry; need separate door model with a fading shadow, to be supplied by Biobak.
development_findings.quote: Is the shadow supposed to fade in? There should be door files though.

development_findings.summary: Outstanding tasks: kick, walk-forward and angry animations from Zeina; natural disappearance sequence; shadows for spike Goombas; finishing boss doors.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is receiving comments asking why he is ‘still’ covering Mario 64 and plans a video clarifying that he’s building his own game, not just optimising vanilla.
context_findings.quote: People don't understand that I'm making a game. They think I'm just making videos.

context_findings.summary: He largely ignores negative feedback but also uses it deliberately to refine his work.
context_findings.quote: I'm the kind of person who will purposefully attract negative comments just to get feedback.

context_findings.summary: Current video pipeline: BLJ explainer this Saturday, then ‘secret reason I’ve been rewriting Mario 64’, then a Missing Link update (outsourced to Zel).
Deep concern in dev community over fresh Nintendo takedowns; Kaze notes lawyers are expensive and creators are worried.
context_findings.quote: There's some stuff going on with Nintendo takedowns and a lot of people are very worried about it.

context_findings.summary: Kaze turns 29 in two weeks, jokes that successful game devs must be ‘mentally unwell’ and enforces self-discipline by staying at the PC until features are done.
context_findings.quote: If you want to be successful making video games you need to be mentally unwell.

biobak.summary: Requested specific changes to Goomba King fight and supplied updated Goomba King model and boss door assets.
biobak.quote: Biobak wanted some changes to it. And I like his proposals.

biobak.summary: Suggested more compelling YouTube titles, which Kaze believes will significantly boost view counts.
biobak.quote: Biobak's idea was The secret reason I've been rewriting Mario 64… that title goes hard.

zeina.summary: Responsible for Goomba animations; Kaze lists missing kick, walk-forward and angry loops that she still needs to deliver.
zeina.quote: It should probably end here, right?… I feel like this is not what Zeina wanted.

key_stories.title: Reinventing the Goomba King
key_stories.summary: Biobak proposes a fresh mechanic where players lure a rolling boulder into the boss instead of chasing him. Kaze spends the stream rewriting AI, physics and animations to make it work.
key_stories.challenge: Original fight felt uninteresting and had animation/logic bugs.
key_stories.process: Kaze fixes spiky Goomba bug, rewrites random movement, programs minion Goombas to push the boulder, tweaks collision, and plans door/shadow effects.
key_stories.outcome: Core behaviour now functional, but missing kick/angry animations and polished door sequence.
key_stories.key_quote: You want the Goomba to pick a place… then the boulder follows Mario, not the other way around, so you have to aim the boulder at him.

key_stories.title: Hardware-Friendly Bloom
key_stories.summary: Kaze experiments with a post-processing bloom effect on real N64 hardware.
key_stories.challenge: N64’s RDP budget is tight; effect risked heavy slowdown.
key_stories.process: Ported a community bloom shader, tested; measures ~7 ms extra frame time.
key_stories.outcome: Deemed acceptable only for small, enclosed stages; parked for later use.
key_stories.key_quote: If it's only 7 milliseconds, it is usable in sub-areas that are really close to perfect.

key_stories.title: The Clickbait Dilemma
key_stories.summary: Kaze debates YouTube titling with chat and Biobak to balance reach and reputation.
key_stories.challenge: Wants growth without being labelled ‘YouTube slop’.
key_stories.process: Discusses algorithm, watch-time, proposed titles, worries about misleading claims.
key_stories.outcome: Settles on stronger titles (‘secret reason…’) while pledging to deliver solid content.
key_stories.key_quote: I want to get views, I don't want to be branded as slop.
